pageTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE RECOMMENDATIONS OF THE SENTENCING COMMISSION REGARDING THE CLASSIFICATION OF UNCLASSIFIED MISDEMEANORS
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {7359=EFFECTIVE DATE: October 1, 2012, except (1) the changes to probation terms are effective October 1, 2012 and applicable to sentences imposed for crimes committed on or after that date and (2) two conforming changes are effective January 1, 2013.}
textBeforeTable: Table 1: Unclassified Misdemeanors Reduced to Mail-in Violations with Fines up to $250 schedule of fines for infractions and violations. Table 1 lists the 34 crimes reduced to mail-in violations with fines of up to $250. Table 2 displays the five crimes reduced to mail-in violations with maximum fines higher than $250. Under the act, 39 of these violations are payable by mail, like infractions, and do not require a court appearance (see § 50). The act sets the maximum fine for each of these violations and authorizes Superior Court judges to set the actual fine that violators will pay by mail in the courts' The act reduces the penalty for 45 unclassified misdemeanors to violations, which are punishable by fines only and not a prison term. UNCLASSIFIED MISDEMEANORS REDUCED TO VIOLATIONS The act also changes the maximum probation or conditional
